NOTE: If you are considering live captioning/streaming for a student’s accommodation need, or if a request for American Sign Language (ASL) interpretation has been received, contact the Student Disability Access Center before proceeding.

A quick start to incorporating a captioning vendor with UVA Zoom account

  1. If you haven’t done so already, establish a UVA Zoom account and download the institutional version of the application to your device from the ITS Software Gateway.
  2. Although Zoom offers options of having the host or a participant provide captions, except in rare instances these are NOT considered best practices and discouraged. Establish a departmental account with a vendor who provides professional live captioning.
  3. Make sure Captions are turned on for your application:
    1. Manage your account by logging through the web-based Zoom portal (zoom.com)
    2. Go to “Settings” and assure that “Captioning” is turned on
  4. Open the Zoom application on your device.
  5. Select CC in the lower menu bar.
  6. Select “Copy the API token”. It will be copied to your clipboard.
  7. Compose an email to your vendor’s contact and paste the token in the body of the message. It will be a long URL. Some vendors may have you paste the token in a web-based scheduling tool.
  8. When the captionist is ready, the CC indicator in the bottom menu bar will turn green.
  9. Each person can turn on/adjust the captions in their own application.
  10. Be sure to ask the transcript be saved and sent to you.
  11. If you are posting a recording of the meeting, you will need to provide accurate captions. Having this transcript will be very helpful. You may need to engage with a different vendor for post-production captioning.
  12. If you save the recording to the Cloud, you can also set Zoom to provide an automatic transcript. You will need to assure accuracy, speaker identification, and follow other best practices. This becomes an “interactive transcript”.
  13. See documentation on the Zoom website or contact your vendor for more information.
